summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The document details her alleged role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of multiple minor victims between 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell allegedly assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating his access to victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Alleged co-conspirators in a scheme to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity. Had a personal and professional relationship; Maxwell was paid to manage Epstein's properties and was in an intimate relationship with him during the relevant period.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's access to minor victims, knowing his sexual preference for underage girls and his intent to abuse them.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to entice and transport minor victims across state and international lines for the purpose of sexual abuse. Specific grooming and abuse incidents involving Minor Victims 1, 2, and 3 occurred during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition (Perjury Count 5)
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and claiming she was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition (Perjury Count 6)
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, denying knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and denying ever giving anyone a massage.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused at Epstein's New York Residence.

events.title: Interaction with Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence, providing an unsolicited topless massage and encouraging the victim to massage Epstein as part of grooming for abuse.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six criminal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the sexual abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein from at least 1994 to 1997.

Three specific minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) are described, with abuse occurring at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and Maxwell's residence in London.

Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during 2016 depositions by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, her interactions with minors, the presence of sex toys, and her own participation in massages.
The document establishes that Maxwell had both an intimate relationship with Epstein and was paid by him to manage his properties during the period of the alleged conspiracy.
